body_text.text: have reported a review of the latest situation and knowledge about the human infectious disease caused by Coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak, which has been announced as a global health emergency by the World Health Organisation (WHO). The authors have summarised many issues concerning the COVID-19 outbreak including the clinical presentation, epidemiology, treatment, prognosis, prevalence, prevention and response to the outbreak. More importantly, while highlighting lessons learned, they have highlighted a number of important issues particularly delayed release of information about the COVID-19 infection, slowness in preventative measures such as quarantine and travel restrictions to contain the outbreak as well as measures to stop spread of misinformation about the COVID-19 [1] .

body_text.text: The WHO data on coronavirus disease (COVID-19) outbreak released on 2 nd March 2020 showed 88,930 confirmed cases and 3,043 deaths involving 65 countries across the five continents [2] . However, the situation is changing and the number of confirmed cases and deaths could rise rapidly.

body_text.text: To prevent the spread of the COVID-19 infection, several measures have been taken by governments and public health authorities. For examples, introduction of new legislation to protect public health from coronavirus outbreak by restriction or detention of suspected cases of coronavirus infection in England [8] . In addition, national and international (public) health organisations have issued guidelines and preventative measures against the coronavirus infection. In addition, some countries have banned large public gathering to contain spread of coronavirus. For example, France has put a ban on crowds of more than 5000 people [9] and Saudi Arabia has temporarily stopped foreign religious pilgrims from visiting Islam's two holiest places in Makkah and Madinah in the country [10] . However, the gender public also needs to follow the public health advice, adopt the suggested preventative measures and comply with the official guidance and measures.

body_text.text: Nonetheless, public access to timely and authentic information concerning health related emergency situations like the Covid-19 outbreak is a very critical to gain public confidence. Otherwise people are highly likely to be misled and misguided by a plethora of misinformation through different channels, which could cause fear among the public. There are signs of public panic such as stockpiling of masks and hand sanitisers leading to empty shells or these items in shops and supermarkets. Restoring public confidence in public health measures in imperative otherwise public fear and apprehension might hinder the local, national, regional and international efforts and measures to tackling global health emergency issues such as the Covid-19 outbreak.

body_text.text: The consequences of COVID-19 outbreak are not limited to human infection and deaths but there are associated social repercussions including racial and xenophobic attacks [3] and adverse economic implications including badly affected travel industry [4] , disturbed supply chain [5] , declining stock exchanges [6] and hardly hit global economy [7] .
body_text.section: A Commentary on "World Health Organization declares Global Emergency: A review of the 2019

body_text.text: Containment of the infectious outbreak caused by COVID-19 is critical and it is possible through joint and coordinated efforts and cooperation between diverse stakeholders at local, national and global levels. There is acute need to pooling resources in research and development including developing vaccine to combat the Coronavirus outbreak.
